designations.source: A review of the status of Larger Brachycera flies of Great Britain
designations.source_description: This report was commissioned to update the threat status of Larger Brachycera flies last undertaken in 1991, using a more modern IUCN methodology for assessing threat
designations.reporting_category: Nationally Scarce, Nationally Rare and Other Species
designations.designation: Nationally Rare. Includes Red Listed taxa
designations.designation_description: Nationally Rare - Occurring in 15 or fewer hectads in Great Britain. Includes rare species qualifying under the main IUCN criteria.
designations.comments: Rhagio strigosus has been recorded from seven hectads since 1990. Over half of these have pre-1990 records, indicating that the species has a stable but tiny population in these squares. There has been no obvious decline and, when the possibly incorrect outlying records are excluded, the population appears to have maintained itself far better than many other rare species.
